string-array.name: language_description
string-array.item: A mobile operating system based on a modified version of Linux Kernel and other open open source software. Designed primarily for mobile devices.
A free open sourced front end development framework for the creation of websites and apps.
An OOP language from Microsoft that aims to combine C++ and programming ease of Visual Basic.
A stylesheet language used to style programs built with HTML and XML.
A software used for tracking changes in any set of files, usually used for coordinating work among programmers collaboratively developing source code during software development.
A code hosting platform vor version control and collaboration.
The set of markup symbols or codes inserted into a file intended for display on the Internet.
An OOP language that produces software for multiple platforms.
A lightweight, interpreted, object-oriented language with first class functions. It is known as the scripting language for Web pages.
A lightweight, "write less, do more" JavaScript library making it easier to use JavaScript on websites.
Javascript Object Notation, is a minimal, readible format for structuring data used to transmit data between a server and a web app, as an alternative to XML.
An open-source, statically-typed programming language that supports both OOP and functional programming.
An open source NoSQL database management program. NoSQL is used as an alternative to traditional relational databases.
A relational management database system developed by Oracle that is based on structured query language (SQL).
An open source development platform for executing JavaScript code on the server side.
A library for building composable user interfaces, encouraging the creation of reusable UI components.
